title: Muir Woods National Monument: Public Involvement
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Public Involvement              Public Involvement        Next Open House - Public Meeting Event   Public Meeting - Muir Woods Parking and Transportation Update The County of Marin and the National Park Service (NPS) invite you to attend a public meeting before the Marin County Board of Supervisors for an update on efforts to address parking and traffic congestion around Muir Woods National Monument.   Meeting Details: Tuesday, June 14, 2016 10:30 am (or as soon thereafter as the matter may be heard)   Marin County Civic Center Board of Supervisors Chambers, Room 329 3501 Civic Center Drive San Rafael, CA   Updates will include:  Progress on the Memorandum of Understanding Implementation of the Muir Woods/ Franks Valley Road parking barrier system additional parking regulations/restrictions Interim parking management strategies Summer 2016 Muir Woods Shuttle, a collaboration between Marin Transit and NPS NPS reservation system update Muir Woods site improvements planning Future Muir Woods/Franks Valley Road improvements associated with the Federal Lands Access Program (FLAP) grant and concrete bridge replacement  View the meeting announcement here.    Recent Open House - Public Meeting Events    Muir Woods Parking and Transportation Update  Wednesday, January 6, 2016 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM Tam Valley Community Center 203 Marin Avenue Mill Valley, CA94941  Please join Marin County Supervisors Kate Sears and Steve Kinsey and GGNRA Superintendent Christine Lehnertz for a report on efforts to address parking and traffic congestion around Muir Woods National Monument. Updates will include:   Progress on the Memorandum of Understanding Construction of parking barriers and improved parking enforcement Planning for the Muir Woods Reservation System Frank Valley Road improvements Brief update on proposed Muir Woods site improvements and Redwood Creek watershed restoration       Marin County Supervisors Public Hearing   Tuesday, June 16, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. Marin Civic Center, 3501 Civic Center Dr., Rm 329, San Rafael, CA   To discuss a contract between the County and the National Park Service regarding Muir Woods traffic & parking.   YouTube video of the May 26, 2015 meeting (1:56:00 hours)   Download a PDF version of the presentation   Download a PDF of the informational handout   Download the Draft MOU (dated May 23, 2015)      The last public meeting was held on Tuesday, May 26, 2015, and was organized by Congressman Jared Huffman. The purpose of the meeting was to share with the public the outline of a draft Memorandum of Understanding between the County of Marin, the National Park Service, and members of an ad-hoc groupcreated by the Congressman to come to a consensus on an approach to addressing traffic and congestion in the area of Muir Woods National Monument.    Public Scoping was initiated on September 4, 2013, followed by the first public meeting on September 18, 2013. A second informational meeting was held on June 18, 2014. During the Question and Answer period, project managers referred to the National Parks Conservation Association's State of the Parks report about Muir Woods. As requested by the public, here are links to the report and fact sheet:   NPCA's State of the Parks report about Muir Woods   NPCA's State of the Parks Fact Sheet about Muir Woods   Tips on how to visit Muir Woods safely this summer or how to find parking   YouTube video of the June 18, 2014 community meeting (2:36 hours)         Sign up for email updates and public meeting notices
